questions.question: Please describe ……………….
questions.description: We do not normally use describe with the structure indirect object + direct object.

questions.question: I would like you to explain …………………..
questions.description: We do not normally use explain with the structure indirect object + direct object.

questions.question: Can you suggest ………………..?
questions.description: We do not normally use suggest with the structure indirect object + direct object.

questions.question: I want you ……………….. my mentor.
questions.description: Before a noun complement ‘to be’ or ‘as’ is used.

questions.question: We will have to wait ………………..
questions.description: That-clauses cannot be used after wait.

questions.question: You can’t make a …………….. pass in rugby.
questions.description: Forward is the adjective. Forwards is an adverb.

questions.question: I look ………………. to hearing from you.
questions.description: In figurative expressions, the form without –s is always used.

questions.question: Do you want ………………. get you something to drink?
questions.description: That-clauses are not normally used after want.

questions.question: We drove …………………
questions.description: Homeward and homewards can both be used as adverbs.

questions.question: There is no way ……………….. that he was lying.
questions.description: After way, we can use the infinitive or ing-form with little difference of meaning.

questions.question: Summer is ……………….
questions.description: On the way can mean coming.
